bibl.title: The Theban Necropolis, Past, Present and Future
bibl.note: 3 figg. et pll. n./bl. et coul. 98-109.

1. Mortuary use of the West Bank in the Roman Period. - 2. The 'Rhind tomb' and the family of Montsuef. - 3. The Soter family group. - 4. The Pebos family group. - 5. The Deir el-Bahari mummy masks. - Conclusion. - Bibliography.
bibl.seg: RIGGS Christina, The Egyptian Funerary Tradition at Thebes in the Roman Period.
Nigel STRUDWICK and John H. TAYLOR (Edd.), The Theban Necropolis, Past, Present and Future (London, 2003) pp. 189-201, 3 figg. et pll. n./bl. et coul. 98-109.
